text: Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar on Tuesday faulted Prime Minister Narendra Modi for remaining silent on issues like the JNU row and demanded immediate sacking of Ram Shankar Katheria over his alleged hate speech in Agra. Replying to questions at a press conference, Mr. Pawar alleged politics of communal polarisation was being played in the country since the Modi government assumed office. — PTI
title: Sharad Pawar questions Modi’s silence
